intro: Stylochaeton angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stylochaeton, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 5 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale yellow to green in color. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Stylochaeton angustifolium is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats.
